    • Method Detail

      • apply

        public abstract T apply(T original)
        Modify the input value and return the modification. It is OK to modify the input value in-place and return it.
        Parameters:
        original - the resolved value
        Returns:
        a modified value

      • setModified

        protected void setModified(boolean modified)
        Set the modification status of this update, defaults to true
        Parameters:
        modified - true if modified

      • isModified

        public boolean isModified()
        true if this Update has modified the input value and requires a store, defaults to true
        Returns:
        true if modified

      • noopUpdate

        public static <T> UpdateValue.Update<T> noopUpdate()
        Returns a no-op Update instance.

        This can be used to simply resolve siblings that exist in Riak without modifying the resolved object.

        Returns:
        An Update instance the does not modify anything.

      • clobberUpdate

        public static <T> UpdateValue.Update<T> clobberUpdate(T newValue)
        Returns an Update that replaces whatever is in Riak.

        This Update simply returns the supplied value, thus replacing anything currently in Riak with that value.

        Parameters:
        newValue - the obj to store in Riak.
        Returns:
        an Update instance.
